 * You can change the type based on the string (e.g., type could be Job, Education or Certification, and it will fall in the appropriate category)
 ***********************************************/
export const resumes = [{
  id: 1,
  institution: "Xccelerate",
  title: "Software Engineer Instructor",
  date: "2021 Spring - Summer",
  type: "Job",
  description: "I taught software engineering over the course of a year, enabling students to build their own fullstack applications, which were typically deployed on AWS.",
  image: ""
}, {
  id: 2,
  institution: "University of Helsinki",
  title: "Software Engineer Teaching Assistant",
  date: "2019 Spring",
  type: "Education",
  description: "This course taught me the basics of the Java programming language and core Object-Oriented Programming concepts. The course is the first of a two semester line of classes from the University of Helsinki, Finland's computer science degree program. This, combined with the second part of the course, is the first year of computer science classes for CS majors.",
  image: ""
}, {
  id: 3,
  institution: "Microsoft",
  title: "Microsoft Javascript Certification",
  type: "Certification",
  date: "2019 Spring",
  description: "This course taught me how to develop prototypes in Javascript and Node.js. I also began learning the basics of back-end development. This certification contains three courses: Building Interactive Prototypes Using JavaScript, Building Functional Prototypes using Node.js and Designing a Technical Solution.",
  image: ""
}, {
  id: 4,
  institution: "Free Code Camp",
  title: "Front End Certifications",
  type: "Certification",
  date: "2019 Spring",
  description: "I completed the first three certifications, each requiring around 300 hours of practice. These certifications (Responsive Web Design, Front End Libraries Certifications and Javascript Algorithms & Data Structures) gave me a broad overview of various tools, such as React, Redux and jQuery.",
  image: ""
}, {
  id: 5,
  institution: "General Assembly",
  title: "Illustrator and Photoshop Bootcamp",
  type: "Certification",
  date: "2019 Spring",
  description: "",
  image: ""
}, {
  id: 6,
  institution: "University of Helsinki",
  title: "Full Stack Web Development",
  type: "Certification",
  date: "2019 Spring",
  description: "This course serves as an introduction to modern web application development with JavaScript. The main focus is on building single page applications with ReactJS that use REST APIs built with Node.js. The course also contains a section on GraphQL, a modern alternative to REST APIs (still in progress).",
  image: ""
}, {
  id: 7,
  institution: "Boston University",
  title: "Special Education (Masters)",
  type: "Education",
  date: "2016-2017",
  description: "I graduated from Boston University in 2017, having completed both my undergraduate and graduate degree. I went on to teach Math, Science and History in Cambridge Rindge and Latin, one of the most diverse high schools in the nation.",
  image: ""
}, {
  id: 7,
  institution: "Boston University",
  title: "Bachelors in Marketing and Minor in Business",
  type: "Education",
  date: "2017 Spring",
  description: "I graduated from Boston University in 2017, having completed both my undergraduate and graduate degree. I went on to teach Math, Science and History in Cambridge Rindge and Latin, one of the most diverse high schools in the nation.",
  image: ""
}, {
  id: 8,
  institution: "Hong Kong International School",
  title: "High School Diploma",
  type: "Education",
  date: "2017 Spring",
  description: "I attended Hong Kong International School for most of my life. I was involved in many different clubs including Debate, Greenpeace and Service on Saturdays. I participated in Debate and was able to travel through Asia with the team competing against different international schools. I was also the captain of the Netball team as well as secretary of the debate team.",
  image: ""
}, {
  id: 9,
  institution: "Cambridge Rindge and Latin",
  title: "Special Education Teacher",
  type: "Job",
  date: "2016",
  description: "I have been teaching in an urban public school (Cambridge) for three years. My role has enabled me to be extremely growth oriented: I am curious on what systems classrooms have in place that allow students to perform at their best. Teaching has furthered my understanding of what it means to problem solve - it is, of course, meeting practical needs, but also ensuring everyone buys into the importance of what I have to share. Without effectively conveying why it is important or worth knowing, students may never care about what they are learning. Understanding how to meet each personâ€™s needs is essential in helping things run smoothly. In other words, it's the skill of managing groups of teenagers while not getting killed.",
  image: ""
}, {
  id: 10,
  institution: "Newton Central High School",
  title: "Math Teacher",
  type: "Job",
  date: "2015-2016",
  description: "In my position as a math teacher, I taught Algebra I and II to freshmen, sophomores and juniors. Over my semester as a student teacher, I made it my priority to stay up to date with the most current pedagogy and teaching methods, as well as custom lesson planning to develop relevant curricula for students in order to maximize their engagement on a variety of complex concepts.",
  image: ""
}, {
  id: 11,
  institution: "Citizenship Foundation",
  title: "Marketing Intern",
  type: "Job",
  date: "2015 Summer",
  description: "During my time at Citizenship Foundation, I was the second-in-charge to the Project Manager in leading the marketing plan. Working closely with different vendors, I designed and ordered over 900 promotional items, ensuring proper quality, look, and price for the desired branding of the company. I was also a part of a two-person team that scripted and developed the various animated characters that would be used at the Convention and on the homepage of the company website. Furthermore, I was able to shadow the sales team, allowing me to learn the process used to identify and find perspective clients, the pitches used to introduce the products, the follow up process, the CRM program used to log the status of existing and perspective clients, as well as gain further insight in the way the sales commission works.",
  image: ""
}];
